Class Component

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.model.component.Component
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BatteryBox, Cabin, Cannon, Engine, LifeSupport, Shield, Storage, StructuralModules
public abstract class Component extends Object implements Serializable
Abstract representation of a generic component within the system. A component has state, orientation, and directional connectors.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • imageName

      protected String imageName
      The name of the image associated with this component. This variable holds a string representing the identifier or file name of the image used to visually represent this component. It can be set or retrieved using the appropriate getter and setter methods.

    • type

      protected String type

  • Constructor Details

    • Component

      public Component()
      Default constructor for Component.

    • Component

      public Component(Map<Direction,ConnectorType> connectors)
      Constructs a Component with specified directional connectors.

      The initial rotation is zero.

      Parameters:
      connectors - a map associating directions to their connector types

  • Method Details

    • getImageName

      public String getImageName()
      Retrieves the name of the image associated with this component.
      Returns:
      a string representing the image name

    • setImageName

      public void setImageName(String imageName)
      Sets the name of the image associated with this component.
      Parameters:
      imageName - the name of the image to associate with this component

    • getRotation

      public int getRotation()
      Retrieves the current rotation value of the component.
      Returns:
      the rotation value

    • getConnectors

      public Map<Direction,ConnectorType> getConnectors()
      Retrieves the map of connectors for this component, associating directions to connector types.
      Returns:
      the map of directional connectors

    • setConnectors

      public void setConnectors(Map<Direction,ConnectorType> connectors)
      Updates the map of directional connectors for this component.
      Parameters:
      connectors - a map associating Direction enums to ConnectorType enums representing the new configuration of connectors for the component

    • rotate

      public void rotate()
      Adjusts the orientation of connectors based on the component's current rotation.

      If rotation is a multiple of 4 (original orientation), no changes occur. Otherwise, connectors' positions are rotated accordingly.

    • insertInComponentsMap

      public void insertInComponentsMap(Map<Class<?>,List<Component>> map)
      Inserts the current instance into a map of components, where the key is the class type of the instance, and the value is a list of objects of that class. If the class type is not already present in the map, a new list is created.
      Parameters:
      map - a map where the key is a Class<?> representing the component's class type, and the value is a list of objects of that class type

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Compares this Component to the specified object for equality. The comparison is based on the `imageName` field.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the object to compare with this Component
      Returns:
      true if the specified object is equal to this Component; false otherwise

    • getComponentName

      protected abstract String getComponentName()
      Retrieves the name of the component. This method must be implemented by subclasses of the Component class.
      Returns:
      a string representing the name of the component

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the component, detailing its visual layout, directional connectors, associated image name, and component name. The format includes a representation of the connectors in the north, south, west, and east directions, as well as the component's visual details.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the component including the image name, component name, and details about the directional connectors

    • getGuiHash

      @NotNull public @NotNull Integer getGuiHash()
      The Method is used in the GUI to recognize whether this component has changed one of its attributes, needs override if one of the attributes must be shown in the graphical interface.
      Returns:
      the hash code of the attribute that might have changed or -1 by default

    • getLabel

      public abstract String getLabel()
      Provides a label identifier for the component.
      Returns:
      a string representing the label of the component

    • getMainAttribute

      public abstract String getMainAttribute()
      Retrieves the main attribute of the component. The exact meaning of the main attribute may vary depending on the specific implementation in a subclass.
      Returns:
      the main attribute of the component as a String
